Detailed Description

This class allows you to load and use custom shaders. You can disable the shader to use standard OpenGL shading again. Furthermore, you can pass variables over to the shader.

Member Function Documentation

void Shader::disable (  )  [static]

Disables the shader, i.e. the fixed function palette of OpenGL is used again

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Shader::enable (  ) 

Enables the shader, i.e. the functionality of the shader is used instead of the fixed function palette of OpenGL

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int Shader::getAttributeLocation ( string  name  ) 

Get location of attribute variable specified by name

Parameters:
name Name of attribute variable in the shader
Returns:
Location of the attribute variable in the shader. You can use this location in the function glVertexAttrib

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Shader::load ( string  vertex,
string  fragment 
)

Loads, compiles and links a shader specified by vertex and fragment

Parameters:
vertex Path and filename of vertex shader
fragment Path and filename of fragment shader

void Shader::loadTextureTU0 ( int  target,
int  texID,
string  name 
)

Loads the texture specified by texID into TU0 and initializes the uniform sampler variable name with 0

Parameters:
target Specifies type of texture (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_ARB, etc.)
texID Handle to the texture to load
name Name of the uniform sampler variable in the shader

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Shader::loadUniform16f ( string  name,
float  value[] 
)

Set uniform variable name to the value specified by value[]. With this function you can set shader variables of type mat4

Parameters:
name Name of uniform variable in the shader
value[] Value to be set (array of type float[16])

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Shader::loadUniform1f ( string  name,
float  value 
)

Set uniform variable name to the value specified by value. With this function you can set shader variables of type float

Parameters:
name Name of uniform variable in the shader
value Value to be set

Here is the call graph for this function:

void Shader::loadUniform1i ( string  name,
int  value 
)

Set uniform variable name to the value specified by value. With this function you can set shader variables of type bool, int and samplerx (all types of samplers)

Parameters:
name Name of uniform variable in the shader
value Value to be set

Here is the call graph for this function:

Member Data Documentation

Shader * Shader::defaultShader = NULL [static]

Define a defaultShader. Disable will use this Shader, if a defaultShader is set
